definition: there is much/(literary) abundance
big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother
see 大夫[dai4 fu5]
to have/there is/there are/to exist/to be
there are plenty of such people
with great prospects for the future (idiom); well worth doing
to accomplish much/to have good prospects/to have a promising future
bringing great benefits (idiom); very useful/of great service/to help greatly/to serve one well
some deeper meaning in this/more to it than meets the eye/there's sth behind all this
to stand a good chance/to have great hopes/to be promising

sentences.english: He thinks that the 2 prospects well.
sentences.chinese: 他認爲此礦大有開採前途。

sentences.english: Repainting the room has really made an improvement.
sentences.chinese: 重新粉刷確實令房間大有改善。

sentences.english: There was considerable discrepancy between the two accounts of the battle.
sentences.chinese: 兩份關於那次戰役的報道大有出入。

sentences.english: China is now steadily developing its economy and there is great potential in bilateral cooperation.
sentences.chinese: 中國經濟正在穩步發展，我們雙方開展合作大有潛力。

sentences.english: In his days the righteous will flourish; prosperity will abound till the moon is no more.
sentences.chinese: 在他的日子義人要發旺，大有平安，好像月亮長存。

sentences.english: But what makes it an attractive place to have a lot to do with its slower pace of life. .
sentences.chinese: 不爲宜居之地似乎與它較慢的生活節奏大有關係。

sentences.english: Mr. Daley says the waste created by sugar refineries is also valuable.
sentences.chinese: 達利先生認爲製糖廠生產的廢料也是大有價值的。

sentences.english: Living conditions have bettered a great deal.
sentences.chinese: 生活條件已經大有改善。

sentences.english: Let's say you have really big aspirations.
sentences.chinese: 假設你是個對未來大有抱負的人。

sentences.english: A well hit drawing tee shot sets up an excellent birdie opportunity on this hole.
sentences.chinese: 好好發出一個左曲球，大有機會打出鳥擊。

sentences.english: The good thing is, he has made great progress in cooking.
sentences.chinese: 好在他現在廚藝大有長進。

sentences.english: By that time, economic conditions could be vastly different, the chief executive, Heather Ridout, has said.
sentences.chinese: 到了那時候，澳洲經濟有可能與現在大有不同。

sentences.english: In the school the German language, to some extent, rivalled the Russian.
sentences.chinese: 學校裏，德語大有與俄語對抗之勢。

sentences.english: And when the queen of Sheba had seen all Solomon's wisdom, and the house that he had built.
sentences.chinese: 示巴女王見所羅門大有智慧，和他所建造的宮室。

sentences.english: This lawyer’s skill is very useful to me as a reference librarian.
sentences.chinese: 律師的技巧對我做好法律圖書館員而言，大有助益。

definition: rather/quite/considerably/oblique/inclined/slanting/Taiwan pr. [po3]
surname Po/Taiwan pr. [Po3]
(quite) a lot/many
it goes without saying/it is self-evident
to be bound to/to be sure to
not very/not too/not often
not at all the same/substantially different
none/completely without
it could even be said
considerably/much/quite a bit
to not need dwell on (idiom)
admittedly (it's true that...)
clearly and easy to see (idiom); obviously/clearly/it goes without saying
lit. late-comer lives above (idiom); the up-and-coming youngster outstrips the older generation/the pupil surpasses the master
very/greatly
to double/to redouble/to increase many times over/to multiply by a factor/multiplication
very small/very little/scant/minimal
